articles.title: Russian Medal Awarded to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Russian Medal Awarded to Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The government of the Russian Federation awarded General Secretary Kim Jong Il a medal for commemoration of the 65th anniversary of the victory in the Great Patriotic War.
					 The ceremony for conveying the commemorative medal took place at the Russian embassy in Pyongyang on Tuesday.
					
					 Present there were DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Vice-Director of the History Institute of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Ri Kwang, officials concerned and Ambassador Valery Sukhinin and staff members of the Russian embassy.
					
					 Valery Sukhinin handed over the medal and its diploma to Pak Ui Chun.

articles.title: Russian Medals Awarded to Korean Fighters
articles.content:
Russian Medals Awarded to Korean Fighters
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The Russian government awarded medals for commemoration of the 65th anniversary of the victory in the Great Patriotic War to anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters Ri Ul Sol, Kim Chol Man, Ri Jong San, Hwang Sun Hui, Kim Ok Sun, Pak Kyong Suk, Ri Yong Suk, Jon Sun Hui and Ri Jong In.
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the Russian embassy in Pyongyang on Tuesday.
					
					 Present there were Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, Ri Kwang, vice-director of the History Institute of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Valery Sukhinin, Russian ambassador, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 The medals and their diplomas were awarded to the fighters.
					
					 A reception was given at the Russian embassy in this regard.

articles.title: Credentials of Turkish Ambassador Acc epted
articles.content:
Credentials of Turkish Ambassador Accepted
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Erdogan Serif Iscan, Turkish ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.
					 After receiving the credentials, Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Blocking Inter-Korean Women Seminar
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Blocking Inter-Korean Women Seminar
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Four women's organizations of the north side including the Central Committee of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea and the Committee on Measures for the Issue of Former Korean "Comfort Women" for the Imperial Japanese Army and Drafting Victims and ten women's organizations of the south side including the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers' Corps and the Women's Solidarity issued a joint statement on Tuesday denouncing the south side's authorities for finally blocking the inter-Korean seminar of women for the solution to the issue of the "comfort women" for the Imperial Japanese Army slated to be held in Pyongyang in late April.
					 The planned seminar to be honored with the presence of the victims of "comfort women" reflected the ardent patriotism and firm will of the women in the north and the south to once again fully expose such hideous crimes committed against Koreans as the horrible sexual slavery enforced by the Japanese imperialists in the past and pressurize Japan to liquidate its past crimes by the concerted efforts of the Koreans, the statement said, and went on: 
					
					 But, the south side's authorities obstructed the preparations for the seminar as evidenced by their action taken to "selectively disallow" the south side's representatives to participate in a working contact between women's organizations from the north and the south for fear that the seminar might provide an occasion in stirring up the anti-Japanese sentiment throughout Korea. And they went the lengths of blocking the seminar in the end under the unreasonable pretext of the "present situation of the inter-Korean relations" and "personal safety."
					
					 This behavior is a blatant challenge to the just struggle of the women in the north and the south to regain the dignity of the women which had been violated by the Japanese imperialists and boost the solidarity and alliance for national independence and the country's reunification. And it is an intolerable treacherous act to break all the Koreans' will to settle accounts with Japan and arrest their anti-Japanese struggle.
					
					 The Korean nation will never pardon the acts of the south side's authorities against the nation, reunification and history as they are persistently violating the legitimate rights of the women in the north and the south and suppress their just solidarity activities for reunification, while shielding and conniving in a humiliating manner at the behavior of Japan evading its responsibility for settlement of the past wrongdoings. 
					
					 The women in the north and the south will as ever intensify the joint actions for settling the "comfort women" issue in the UN and other international arenas and unfailingly realize the seminar within this year and thus fully demonstrate the strong anti-Japanese patriotic will and might of the Korean women in the eyes of the anti-reunification forces and pro-Japanese lackeys inside and outside Korea.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Fallen Fighters of CPV
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Fallen Fighters of CPV
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the families of fallen fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers headed by Guan Youfei, deputy director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Ministry of National Defense, laid wreaths before the grave of Mao Anying and the cemetery of fallen fighters of the CPV in Hoechang County, South Phyongan Province, on Tuesday.
					Present there were officers of the Korean People's Army, officials of party and power organs in the county and military attaches of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					Laid before the grave and the cemetery were wreaths in the name of the DPRK Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, party and power organs in the county, the Chinese embassy and the delegation.
					
					Also placed before the grave of Mao Anying was a wreath in the name of the martyr's family.
					
					The participants paid silent tribute to Mao Anying and other fallen fighters of the CPV who laid down their lives while heroically fighting in the Korean war.
					
					The delegation visited the Songhung Revolutionary Site and laid a wreath before the Friendship Tower on the same day.

articles.title: 5th Symposium on Architectural Beauty Held
articles.content:
5th Symposium on Architectural Beauty Held
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The 5th symposium on architectural beauty took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday.
					 Present there were Vice-Premier of the Cabinet O Su Yong, Minister of State Construction Control Pae Tal Jun, Minister of Urban Management Hwang Hak Won, Minister of Capital City Construction Kim Ung Gwan, and officials, designers, technicians, teachers, researchers and creators in the fields of architecture, construction and building materials from Pyongyang and local areas. 
					
					 Speakers stressed the need to attach importance to architectural science research, saying that this provides a fundamental guarantee for pushing back the frontiers of the latest science in the architectural creation. 
					
					 They also called for introducing new structures and building materials in the construction of houses and proposed such ways for perfecting buildings in architectural style as modernization of construction equipment and tools and application of formative arts to the construction.

articles.title: 12th Pyongyang Symposium on Medical Science Held
articles.content:
12th Pyongyang Symposium on Medical Science Held
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The 12th Pyongyang symposium on medical science of Koreans at home and abroad took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Monday and Tuesday.
					 Present there were officials in the field of public health including Ri Pong Hun, chairman of the Central Committee of the Medical Association of Korea, medical scientists and the delegation of Korean medical men in Japan led by Kim Chun Saeng and the delegation of Korean medical men in the United States headed by Choe Hye Suk.
					
					 Ri Pong Hun in an opening address expressed the hope that the symposium would be conductive to developing the medical science and technology into a higher stage in the idea of "By our nation itself" this year marking the 10th anniversary of the publication of the historic June 15 joint declaration. 
					
					 Kim Chun Saeng made a congratulatory speech. 
					
					 Then followed panel symposiums on internal medicine and external medicine which heard scores of papers titled "Diabetes updated", "Medicine and the Internet in the 21st century" and "Clinical study on the improvement of the management of the triplet pregnant women's health".  
					
					 Introduced in the papers were valuable research achievements and experience gained in the course of settling the scientific and technological problems essential for practice of public health and applying the successes made in the latest scientific and technological field to the prevention and treatment of diseases.

articles.title: New Stamp Issued
articles.content:
New Stamp Issued
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- A new stamp has been issued in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to mark the opening of the 2010 Shanghai World Expo.
					 Seen in the upper part of the sheetlet with the background of Pyongyang, the capital of Korea, and Shanghai, a city of China, is an inscription "Expo 2010 Shanghai China" in Korean, Chinese and English.
					
					 Printed in the center of the sheetlet are a picture of Pyongyang prospering on the basis of the culture of the River Taedong, the emblem of the exposition and a poster reflecting the ideal of humankind for beautifying towns on the theme of the exposition "Better City, Better Life".

articles.title: University Teachers Active in Developing New Technologies
articles.content:
University Teachers Active in Developing New Technologies
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- University teachers and researchers of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea are playing a big role in introducing new technologies into economic sectors.
					 Those from Kim Il Sung University, together with technicians and workers of the Chollima Steel Complex, successfully applied CNC technology to a 10,000-ton press in a short span of time to reduce the forging time and power consumption by half and considerably enhance the precision of forgings.
					
					 They also developed software needed for supplying the UHP electric arc furnace with energy on a normal basis.
					
					 Researchers of Kim Chaek University of Technology established an electric power management system and a remote control system of electric frequency at the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex. They also employed a monitoring system in production processes.
					
					 Those from the Robotics Institute of the university put the profiler of the Sinuiju Spinning Machine Plant on a CNC basis and completed technical preparations for applying CNC technology to equipment of the Rakwon Machine Complex and the Pyongyang Textile Machine Plant.
					
					 Teachers and researchers from the Chongjin University of Mining and Metallurgy have paved a way of putting the finish rolling process of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex on a CNC basis.
					
					 Researchers of Sariwon University of Geology who went to the Komdok Mining Complex applied IT to technical management and put the design and development of pits on a scientific basis. They also introduced a ground pressure measuring program, thus making it possible to take proper steps against it.

articles.title: Pukchang Area Endowed with Large Coal Reserves
articles.content:
Pukchang Area Endowed with Large Coal Reserves
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The Pukchang Area Coal Mining Complex located in the northern part of South Phyongan Province is one of the major coal producers in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The demand for high-caloric coal produced in Pukchang area, with billons of tons of deposits, is ever growing in the country.
					
					 Last year the complex boosted the production 1.5 times compared with the previous year by expanding the Phunggok Mine and carried out its assignments for the first quarter of this year at 136.6 percent.
					
					 It is now developing new coal fields in Namdok, Hoean, Inpho and other mines to surpass the yearly target.
					
					 Its material and technological foundations have been consolidated considerably.
					
					 Founded in February Juche 73 (1984), the complex has topped its plan every year, contributing to the economic growth of the country.

articles.title: US Talk about "Missile Threats" Rejected
articles.content:
US Talk about "Missile Threats" Rejected
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The United States' noisier trumpeting about the fictitious "missile threats" from the DPRK and Iran is nothing but a cynical plot to justify its frantic moves to establish a missile defence system (MD).
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes this in a signed commentary.
					
					 The U.S. seeks to collect more taxes from the people under the pretext of "defence" and zealously plug its allies into its criminal MD in a bid to impose increasing financial burdens upon them, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is a foolish and gross miscalculation for the U.S. to justify its MD for aggression under the pretext of what it called "missile threats" and bar the DPRK from bolstering up its deterrent for self-defence.
					
					 The DPRK will increase in every way its deterrent for self-defence, a fundamental guarantee and an invincible treasured sword for protecting its sovereignty, no matter what others may say under the present situation where the enemies' moves for aggression and military blackmail persist.
					
					 The U.S. moves to establish MD go to clearly indicate who is the arch criminal escalating the arms race at present. 
					
					 It is the U.S. wild ambition and action standard to upset the strategic equilibrium through the arms race and attain its hegemonic objective by maintaining an unchallenged military edge. 
					
					 With no artifice can the U.S. justify its moves to establish MD under the pretext of "missile threats" from someone.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to drop its foolish scenario to attain its sinister purpose under the pretext of "missile threats".

articles.title: S. Korea's Moves to Revive Conception of "Principal Enemy" Flailed
articles.content:
S. Korea's Moves to Revive Conception of "Principal Enemy" Flailed
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The "Committee for Promoting Defense Reform", an advisory body under the south Korean puppet minister of Defense, is contemplating a proposal to include again into the "defense white paper" the conception that the "north is the principal enemy". Meanwhile, the puppet group let wicked conservative organizations and human scum hold a "rally" in Seoul to kick off an anti-DPRK human rights campaign, vociferating about "freedom" and "human rights".
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a signed commentary carried in this regard:
					
					 The ruckus kicked up by the puppet group to revive the conception about "the principal enemy" self-exposed that it is dead-set against reconciliation and cooperation with fellow countrymen and seeks to escalate confrontation and, furthermore, realize its ambition for invading the north in reliance upon armed forces.
					
					 It dares try to tarnish the image of the DPRK, denying its most dignified system in the world. This is intolerable as it is a vivid manifestation of the undisguised repugnance and hostility toward the DPRK.
					
					 By derailing the tour of Mt. Kumgang the conservative group of south Korea pushed the inter-Korean relations to the worst phase. Now it has gone the lengths of reviving the conception about "the principal enemy" and desperately kicking up a despicable anti-DPRK human rights campaign in a bid to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen, totally denying its ideology and system. This is, however, nothing but the last-ditch effort of those keen on confrontation.
					
					 The group of traitors had better stop at once the foolish confrontation racket, not forgetting the miserable end their predecessors met while going mad with confrontation with fellow countrymen.

articles.title: S. Korea Urged to Behave Itself
articles.content:
S. Korea Urged to Behave Itself
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative group blustered that it would take "a countermeasure" if the north side did not "retract" its measure for freezing the real estates of the south side in the Mt. Kumgang Tourist Zone. As if it were not enough with this, it made no scruple of staging north-targeted "joint live shell firing exercises" with the U.S. forces near the Military Demarcation Line on the Day of the Sun, while crying out for "not ruling out a war". 
					 In this regard Minju Joson Tuesday says in a signed commentary:
					
					 The south Korean conservative group is entirely to blame for the present tragic situation where the north side was compelled to confiscate the south side's real estates which had been frozen in the tourist zone and freeze the remaining real estates, thus making it impossible for south Koreans to tour the famous mountain of the nation. 
					
					 Had the south Korean authorities lent an ear to the north's warnings and shown even the least concern for the resumption of the tour of Mt. Kumgang, the situation would not have reached such a serious phase.
					
					 The conservative group, however, is letting loose such outbursts that it would announce "a countermeasure" early in May and is talking about the "examination of the way of tightening financial resources", etc., while shelving its crimes. 
					
					 This proves that the group has not yet come to its senses, unaware of who its rival is.
					
					 It goes without saying that it would be impossible to settle the issue of the resumption of the tour of Mt. Kumgang nor is it possible to improve the north-south relations as long as the group is allowed to stay in power. 
					
					 The conservative group should come to its senses and behave with discretion, though belatedly. If it continues deteriorating the situation, hell-bent on the moves for escalating confrontation with the DPRK as it does now, the DPRK will take more strong punitive measures just as it had already clarified.

articles.title: Anti-"Government" Actions Staged across S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-"Government" Actions Staged across S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Anti-"government" actions were staged across south Korea on Saturday last, May Day, with more than 100,000 people from all walks of life involved.
					 An "All-people May Day rally" held in Seoul was attended by over 15,000 people of at least 2,000 organizations such as the Confederation of Trade Unions and the Solidarity for Progress.
					
					 Speakers at the rally lashed out at the authorities for blocking a reunification event of workers in the south and the north to mark May Day.
					
					 The authorities are sadly mistaken if they calculate that the suppression of the democratic trade union movement will bring the resistance of workers and other people to an end, they said.
					
					 Noting that it is the only way of achieving democracy and winning the rights of the workers to bring down the treacherous regime, the speakers called for judging the authorities by concerted efforts through the forthcoming "election to the local self-governing bodies".
					
					 The Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration issued a statement on April 30 on the occasion of May Day in which it condemned the puppet authorities for their unpopular labor policy.

articles.title: Foreign Ministry Memorandum Distributed as UNSC Official Document
articles.content:
Foreign Ministry Memorandum Distributed as UNSC Official Document
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- "Korean Peninsula and Nuclear Weapons", a memorandum of the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK, was distributed as official document of the UNSC S/2010/205 on April 28.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Lauded by Russian
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Lauded by Russian
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Pavel Ovsyannikov, head and chief conductor of the "Orchestra of the 21st Century" of Russia, on a visit to the DPRK was interviewed on May 2.
					 Referring to his honor of having performed before General Secretary Kim Jong Il, he said that he was greatly impressed by the traits of Kim Jong Il who has shown great interest for the development of the literature and arts.
					
					 He further said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il is deeply versed in the arts. His rich knowledge about music caught my admiration. He is really a great master of the arts.
					
					 The DPRK represented the Russian opera "Evgeni Onegin". It is thanks to the meticulous guidance of Kim Jong Il that the younger generation of the DPRK successfully represented the opera.
					
					 Under his leadership the literature and arts of the DPRK are developing as the days go by.
					
					 I, as a musician, will exert more positive efforts for the Russia-DPRK friendly relations in the future.

articles.title: Birthday of KPA Observed in Brazil
articles.content:
Birthday of KPA Observed in Brazil
Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The Brazil-Korea Friendship Association issued a bulletin under the title "78 years of victories under the guidance of brilliant commanders" on April 25 to commemorate the 78th founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					The bulletin in its article stressed that the 78 year-long history covered by the KPA represents a history of victory and glory in which it has defended and glorified independence, sovereignty and socialism under the leadership of the peerlessly brilliant commanders while winning one victory after another in the showdown with the formidable imperialist enemies. 
					
					The foundation of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army by President Kim Il Sung on April 25, 1932 provided the Korean people with a sure guarantee for accomplishing the cause of national liberation with an armed struggle as the main trend, the bulletin said.
					
					After liberating the country the President put primary efforts into developing the Korean People's Revolutionary Army into the regular Korean People's Army, the bulletin said, adding: Under his leadership the KPA defeated the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world in the Fatherland Liberation War, thus reliably defending the sovereignty of the country.
					
					Thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il the KPA could open a new chapter in its development, the bulletin said, stressing that he, possessed of extraordinary wisdom and stratagem and outstanding commanding art no one can match, has ushered in a great heyday of army-building.

articles.title: Anniversary of April 19 Popular Uprising Observed in Japan
articles.content:
Anniversary of April 19 Popular Uprising Observed in Japan
 Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in areas of Hiroshima, Kanto, Kansai and Tokai of Japan on April 24 and 25 to mark the 50th anniversary of the April 19 Popular Uprising.
					 They were attended by members of the south Korean Democratic Alliance for Reunification in Japan (Hanthongryon), the south Korean Youth League in Japan (Hanchong), the south Korean Democratic Women's Society in Japan and the south Korean Students Council for National Reunification in Japan and other Koreans in Japan.
					
					 Speakers at the meetings referred to the historic significance of the uprising.
					
					 They charged that the present regime in south Korea is intensifying the fascist suppression of people from all walks of life, defiling the spirit of the participants in the April 19 uprising who fought for independence, democracy and reunification and, at the same time, unreasonably cracking down upon Hanthongryon and Hanchong, organizations of Koreans in Japan.
					
					 The Koreans in Japan will wage a more dynamic struggle to foil the south Korean authorities' crackdown and put an end to the U.S. domination and interference in south Korea, they declared.
					
					 At the end of the meetings, the participants conducted a signature campaign for peace in Northeast Asia.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales del embajador turco
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales del embajador turco
Pyongyang, 4 de mayo (ATCC) -- El nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica de Turquia en Corea, Erdogan Serif Iscan, entrego el dia 4 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae sus cartas credenciales al presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam.
					Acto seguido, Kim departio con el representante diplomatico.

articles.title: Entidades femeninas de Norte y Sur condenan a autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
Entidades femeninas de Norte y Sur condenan a autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 4 de mayo (ATCC) -- Debido a las maniobras obstructivas de las autoridades surcoreanas, quedo abortado por fin el seminario femenino intercoreano para la solucion del problema de las ex "consoladoras sexuales" para el viejo ejercito japones, el cual estaba previsto para finales de abril.
					Al respecto, las 4 entidades femeninas del Norte, inclusive el CC de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea y el Comite Coreano de Medidas por la Indemnizacion a las "Consoladoras" de las Tropas Japonesas y Victimas de Arresto Forzoso, y las 10 del Sur como el Consejo por la Solucion del Problema de las Tropas de Voluntarias y la Solidaridad Nacional de Mujeres, hicieron publica este martes una declaracion conjunta.
					
					 El planeamiento de tal seminario fue una muestra de calido amor por la nacion y firme voluntad de las mujeres de ambas partes coreanas de exigir con las fuerzas unidas nacionales a Japon liquidar su pasado criminal, al volver a desenmascarar a todo el mundo, en presencia de las victimas que se vieron obligadas a servir de "consoladoras sexuales" del viejo ejercito japones,  los archi-crimenes antieticos perpetrados en el pasado por los imperialistas japoneses contra la nacion coreana, incluyendo ese aborrecible regimen de esclavitud sexual, senala el documento y prosigue:
					
					 Pero, por su temor a que se alzara el clima antijapones a escala nacional con motivo de ese foro, las autoridades surcoreanas estropearon los preparativos "poniendose selectivas en dar permiso" a las delegados surcoreanas al contacto de trabajo de las entidades femeninas de ambas partes y lo abortaron finalmente bajo injustos pretextos como la "situacion actual de las relaciones Sur-Norte" y la "seguridad personal".
					
					  Este comportamiento deviene desafio frontal a la lucha justa de las mujeres del Norte y el Sur por rescatar la dignidad de las mujeres violadas por los imperialistas japoneses y fortalecer mas la solidaridad y la alianza por la independencia nacional y la reunificacion de la patria e imperdonable crimen antinacional para frustrar la determinacion de todos los coreanos de ajustar las cuentas con Japon y la lucha antijaponesa.
					
					  La nacion coreana no perdonara jamas las maniobras antinacionales, anti-reunificacion y antihistoricas de las autoridades surcoreanas que se obstinan en desbaratar los derechos legitimos de las mujeres nortenas y surenas y frenar sus justas actividades solidarias en pro de reunificacion amparando tacita y humillantemente a Japon que elude liquidar su pasado lleno de crimenes.
					
					  En el futuro tambien al igual que en el pasado, las mujeres de ambas partes coreanas seguiran luchando activa y conjuntamente en la ONU y otros escenarios internacionales por dar solucion al citado problema de las ex "consoladoras" y celebraran sin falta dentro de este ano el seminario frustrado esta vez. 
					
					De esta manera, demostraran sin reservas a los opositores a la reunificacion dentro y fuera del pais y a los vendepatrias projaponeses la firme voluntad patriotica antijaponesa y el poderio de las mujeres coreanas.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia a EE.UU, que habla de "amenaza de misiles"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia a EE.UU, que habla de "amenaza de misiles"
Pyongyang, 4 de mayo (ATCC) -- En estos dias, Estados Unidos habla tanto de "amenaza de misiles" por la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea e Iran, lo cual es para justificar sus freneticas maniobras de establecimiento del sistema antimisiles.
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este martes y continua:
					
					EE.UU. intenta recaudar la mayor cantidad de impuestos de los habitantes norteamericanos bajo el rotulo de la "defensa" e introducir a las naciones aliadas en sus maquinaciones criminales de establecer el sistema antimisiles imponiendoles las cargas financieras.
					
					Tambien, trata de justificar dicho sistema antimisiles so pretexto de tal "amenaza de misiles" e impedir el fortalecimiento del disuasivo autodefensivo de la RPDC, lo cual es absurdo y vano.
					
					Bajo las circunstancias en que se intensifican de continuo las maniobras de agresion y chantaje militar de los enemigos, la RPDC intensificara por todos los medios tal disuasivo que es una garantia fundamental de la defensa de la soberania e invencible remedio omnipotente.
					
					Por lo tanto, el establecimiento del sistema antimisiles demuestra claramente quien es el autor de la carrera armamentista en la epoca actual. A traves de la carrera armamentista, EE.UU. pretende destruir el equilibrio estrategico y tomar la absoluta supremacia militar y realizar su objetivo dominacionista. Esto es descarada ambicion y norma de accion de EE.UU.
					
					Este imperio debe abandonar su artimana tendente a realizar el proposito malsano bajo la llamada "amenaza de misiles" de alguien.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena concepcion de "enemigo principal"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena concepcion  de "enemigo principal"
Pyongyang, 4 de mayo (ATCC) -- Ahora, el "comite de promocion de la reforma de defensa nacional", organismo consultivo adscrito al ministro titere de Defensa Nacional del Sur de Corea, conspira el proyecto de incluir de nuevo la concepcion de que "el Norte es el enemigo principal" en la "carta blanca de la defensa nacional".
					 Por otra parte, los titeres surcoreanos hacen que las malsanas entidades conservadoras y otras gentuzas organicen en Seul una "conferencia" para desarrollar una campana intrigante de "DDHH" denigrando perversamente a la RPDC so pretexto de la "libertad" y "DDHH", senala el comentario individual del diario Rodong Sinmun difundido este martes y continua:
					
					  Mediante los alborotos para rehabilitar la concepcion del "enemigo principal" los titeres surcoreanos demuestran por si mismos que no desean ni en lo minimo la reconciliacion y la colaboracion con los connacionales sino tratan de agravar la confrontacion y, a la larga, realizar su ambicion de agredir con fuerzas armadas a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					
					  Los titeres surcoreanos intentan de negar y denigrar el sistema de la RPDC mas prestigiosa en este mundo, lo cual no puede tolerarse jamas como expresion concentrada de la negacion y hostilidad abiertas a la RPDC.
					
					  La banda conservadora surcoreana, que llevo a la irremediable coyuntura peor las relaciones Norte-Sur al destruir el turismo al monte Kumgang, pretende resucitar hasta la teoria del "enemigo principal" y recurre mas perversamente en la campana malsana de "DDHH" para enfrentarse hasta el fin con los connacionales negando totalmente la idea y el sistema de la RPDC.
					
					  Pero, esto no pasa de ser los ultimos esfuerzos de los locos en la confrontacion.
					
					  La banda de traidores debe abandonar de inmediato sus absurdos alborotos de enfrentamiento recordando el tragico destino de sus antecedentes que habian actuado locamente para la confrontacion fratricida.

articles.title: Distribuido como documento de ONU memorandum de MINREX de Corea
articles.content:
Distribuido como documento de ONU memorandum de MINREX de Corea
Pyongyang, 4 de mayo (ATCC) -- El memorandum del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea: "La Peninsula Coreana y el nucleo" fue distribuido el dia 28 de abril como documento oficial No. S/2010/205 del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU.
